Bibliographic References: PP, no. 151, pi. 16 a; PPSupp, no. 194; EAA i, p. 544, fig. 729; Simon, AA 1979, p. 37, fig. 5; F. Rossi, in // Museo Arch, di Bari (ed. E. M . D e Juliis), p. 77, pi. 46,2; LIMC II, Archernoros 2, pi. 255, 9.
Imagery Description: Death of Opheltes (Archernoros). Only fragments of the lower part of the scene remain, showing the serpent consuming the r. arm of Opheltes, part of a draped woman (Hypsipyle) and a hydria and a tree to r., with a small portion of another figure to 1.
